theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Reduced GH/IGF-1 Signaling and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on how reduced GH/IGF-1 signaling decreases pro-aging pathways, oxidative stress, and genomic instability to extend lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Reduced GH/IGF-1 Signaling and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes GH/IGF-1 axis attenuation leading to lifespan extension and metabolic health improvements in mouse models.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Reduced GH/IGF-1 Signaling and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes GH/IGF-1/insulin pathway genetic variants affecting growth and longevity, linking reduced signaling to extended lifespan.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Details genetic mutations in GH/IGF-1 pathway that extend lifespan via oxidative damage resistance and metabolic changes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Reduced GH/IGF-1 Signaling and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Summarizes lifespan extension by reduced GH/IGF-1 signaling through metabolic and endocrine alterations and evolutionary trade-offs.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on reduced IGF-1 and insulin signaling leading to longevity, supported by multiple animal models and genetic mechanisms.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows GH/IGF-1 axis disruption extends lifespan and delays age-related diseases with sex- and tissue-specific effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Reduced GH/IGF-1 Signaling and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes GH/IGF-1 loss-of-function mutations extending lifespan and Klotho protein’s role in modulating IGF-1 signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Reduced GH/IGF-1 Signaling and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details GHR gene disruption causing GH resistance, reduced IGF-1, and lifespan extension, supporting conserved aging mechanisms.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on dwarf mouse models with reduced somatotropic signaling leading to extended lifespan and delayed aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Reduced GH/IGF-1 Signaling and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links Prop1df mutation causing GH/IGF-1 deficiency to altered gene expression and extended longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Differential GH, IGF-1, and IRS Signaling Effects on Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Distinguishes lifespan effects of reduced GH, IGF-1, and IRS signaling, highlighting their differential impacts on aging rate and mortality.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Differential GH, IGF-1, and IRS Signaling Effects on Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses tissue-specific modulation of GH/IGF-1/insulin signaling and metabolic adaptations in longevity, including centenarian insights.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Differential GH, IGF-1, and IRS Signaling Effects on Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explores complex, stage- and tissue-specific roles of GH/IGF-1 in development and aging with species and sex differences.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: GH/INS/IGF Nutrient Response and Stem Cell Depletion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on GH/INS/IGF nutrient signaling causing stem cell depletion (VSELs) and aging, with epigenetic regulation and caloric restriction effects.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes nutritional modulation of GH/IGF-1 signaling affecting aging, cancer risk, and differential stress resistance.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Details caloric restriction’s impact on GH/IGF-1 axis reducing cancer incidence and extending lifespan.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Links GH/IGF-1 signaling levels to aging, oxidative stress, cancer development, and reproductive aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: GH/IGF-1 Axis Decline and Brain Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related GH/IGF-1 decline impairing neuronal function, synaptic plasticity, and cognitive aging.
